Title: Registered Nurse (RN) - Vancouver, BC - Indeed.com
Description:
Seeking qualified RNs and/or LPNs to join our growing team to conduct Covid-19 testing for the film industry, and our mobile covid testing clinic and travel testing office. Candidates must have a valid driver’s license and a vehicle to travel to various locations around the Lower Mainland. Likely to included evening and weekend work.
Duties & Responsibilities
· Provide Covid-19 testing in adherence with infection control policies and procedures
· Maintain confidential and accurate testing records
· Collaborate with the Administrator and Project Manager to facilitate efficient testing services
Skills & Qualifications
·
Must
hold current practicing registration with the
British Columbia College of Nurses and Midwives (BCCNM).
· Effective time-management and multitasking ability
· Strong interpersonal skills
· Ability to adapt to changing environments in a calm and professional manner
·
Must
have a valid driver’s license & vehicle to travel to various locations around the Lower Mainland
Job Type: Part-time, Temporary, Contract
Reference ID: Align-RN Nov 2021
Part-time hours: 20-30 per week
Job Types: Part-time, Temporary, Casual
Salary: $55.00 per hour
Schedule:
Day shift
Monday to Friday
Night shift
Weekend availability
COVID-19 considerations:
Regular Covid testing of employees, PPE provided

Bachelor's Degree (required)
Licence/Certification:
Registered Nurse (RN) License (required)
Work remotely:
No

Title: Registered Nurse, Renal Outpatient - Kelowna, BC - Indeed.com
Description:
Job title
:REGISTERED NURSE, RENAL OUTPATIENT
Community
:KELOWNA
Facility
:KELOWNA GENERAL HOSPITAL
Status
:CASUAL
Position Summary
We are seeking a reliable and motivated Registered Nurse, with great shift availability to join our renal nursing team for casual shifts in our Renal Outpatient Clinic in Kelowna. Days of work may be Monday through Friday from 08:00-16:00, on an as needed basis.
The Registered Nurse practices in a variety of clinical settings and is responsible for the assessment, planning, implementation and evaluation of client care. Working in collaboration with the interdisciplinary team, the Registered Nurse ensures the delivery of client–centered care by assisting individual clients and their families respond to changing health care needs. The Registered Nurse demonstrates a specialized body of knowledge and bases practice on nursing science and related content from other sciences and humanities.
If you have successfully completed a renal specialty education and training program, and have recent experience working with renal clients, then we would love to hear from you!
Qualifications
Graduation from an approved school of Nursing with current practicing registration with the British Columbia College of Nurses and Midwives (BCCNM).
Successful completion of recognized advanced clinical preparation in the assigned renal specialty area plus two years recent related experience in the assigned renal specialty area, (which may include experience in chronic kidney disease, peritoneal dialysis, home hemodialysis and/or organ transplantation depending on the assigned clinical area) and one year recent related teaching experience required; or an equivalent combination of education, training and experience.
Current BCLS certification required.
Valid BC Driver’s License required.
We invite applicants to self-identify as First Nation, Métis or Inuit within cover letters and/or resumes.
Interior Health offers assistance from an Aboriginal Employment Advisor. If you self-identify as Aboriginal (First Nations, Métis or Inuit) and if you would like assistance email AboriginalEmployment@interiorhealth.ca

Title: Nurse, Labour and Delivery Delegate (Anticipatory recruitment) - Canada - Indeed.com
Description:
Do you want to make a difference?
Join the world's largest humanitarian network. The Canadian Red Cross Society (CRCS) is a not for profit, humanitarian organization dedicated to helping Canadians, as well as the most vulnerable throughout the world.
CRCS is currently seeking experienced
Nurses in Labour and Delivery
to be part of the Emergency Response Unit (ERU) roster of the Canadian Red Cross. ERU Delegates are trained and ready to be deployed for 4 to 6 weeks on short notice in the event of an overseas emergency.
Key Tasks and Responsibilities
1. To plan and support maternal-child health care (MCH) activities together with the host National Society and / or local health authorities. This may include:
Ante-natal care (incl. uncomplicated pregnancy)
Labour and delivery (incl. uncomplicated pregnancy)
Post-natal care
Support to Safe Motherhood and breastfeeding initiatives
Immunisation of mother and child
Paediatric care
Family planning
Nutritional surveillance
2. To work with and / or train traditional birth attendants (TBA) and community health workers (CHW) according to public health principles and local health standards.
3. To manage the obstetrics ward and delivery room
4. To coordinate referrals from the out-patient department or other clinics
5. To provide all emergency obstetric cases (incl. assistance with caesarean sections as needed and/or facilitating referral and transport to a specialized care facility).
6. To work with and/or train local midwives/nurses according to public health principles and local health standards.
7. To provide regular and timely reports, inclusive of health statistics according to health monitoring system.
8. To support the capacity of the host National Society and develop clinical skills where possible.
To deploy with us on national or international missions as an ERU Nurses in Labour and Delivery delegate, you must have:
Registered Nurse in Canada with a valid professional license and with over five years experience in labour and delivery
Comfortable managing maternal health and peri-natal care in a low-resource environment
Able to work independently and consult MD/refer patients as needed
Comfortable with carrying out pre- and post-natal consultations
Capable of decision-making in conditions of uncertainty
Experience of managing and supporting staff
Experience in living or working in a cultural context other than your own
Able to work with limited resources
Able to be innovative and at ease in problem solving
Capable of handling extreme stress, change and situations of insecurity
Competent in computer use (Windows, Microsoft Office, spreadsheets, word-processing, and e-mail)
Fluent in English
Must be already eligible to work in Canada.
You will stand out if you have:
Fluency in more than one language including French, Spanish, and/or Arabic
Experience working for the Red Cross/Red Crescent movement
Experience working for a humanitarian aid organisation in a developing country
Experience with the management of medical resources
Additional Requirements
Ability to deploy for 4-6 weeks on short notice
A valid passport (with at least 6 months validity)
A valid provincial driver’s license (with ability to drive manual gears)
A valid First Aid certificate
Ability to complete a satisfactory Canadian criminal record reference check
Ability to complete a satisfactory vulnerable sector check
Full vaccination against COVID-19 is mandatory for this position and operation (the CRC will however adhere to its duty to accommodate those who are unable to be fully vaccinated for a reason related to a human right protected ground)
What we offer our delegates:
Competitive pay and benefits package
Travel, accommodation, medical & insurance coverage when deploying
Pre-deployment and recurring training programs and professional development events in Canada and abroad
And much more! See the list here: http://www.redcross.ca/about-us/jobs/before-you-apply/benefits
Want to foresee how you will make a difference? Visit our following websites below to get a glimpse of what we do, aspire to be one of our many current delegates, locate where we deploy, and much more!
http://www.redcross.ca/about-us/jobs/who-is-needed/emergency-response-delegates
https://www.facesofhumanity.redcross.ca/
The Canadian Red Cross is committed to diversity and inclusion in our workplace. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, race, color, religion, national origin, disability, age, or any other characteristic protected by law. We welcome applications from all applicants particularly Indigenous persons, persons with disabilities, ethnic minorities, visible minorities, and others who may contribute to diversification and share our values.
Please notify us as soon as possible of any adaptive measures you might require at any stage of the recruitment process.

Title: Registered Nurse Women's Virtual - Toronto, ON - Indeed.com
Description:
The Registered Nurse in Women’s Virtual (WV) supports patients and provides comprehensive care and care planning for patients within a virtual care setting. Specifically, the Registered Nurse will support the care of COVID positive patients within the CC@H program either by phone/video or through a remote monitoring application called Digital Care Coach.
Summary of Duties, but not limited to:
Assesses, plans, implements and evaluates patient care in compliance with the scope of practice
Provides care, resources and information in a compassionate and caring manner for diverse population groups, especially COVID patients and geriatric patients virtually; including providing remote monitoring
Identifies and prioritizes for the physical, psychological, social and spiritual needs of the patient
Collaborates with members of the health care team to ensure standards of care and practice are met
Liaises with the community to facilitate the continuity of patient care across the hospital system partners
Prioritizes patient care and provides a safe and secure environment for patients and staff
Participates in team meetings and quality improvement projects
Delegates and assigns clinical tasks to the appropriate provider as necessary
Acts as a mentor, coach, clinical resource, consultant, and facilitates all activities to promote excellence of care
As a role model and champion you will work to identify and integrate safe, best practices into daily activities to foster the delivery of safe and exemplary care.
Is available to work weekends to support virtual programs
The responsibilities described above are representative and are not to be construed as all-inclusive.
Company Bio
Women's College Hospital (WCH) is an academic, ambulatory care hospital in Ontario with a focus on health for women, health equity and health system solutions. If you're ready to be part of a team that is revolutionizing the future of healthcare, then you will want to join an institution where the possibilities for innovation, new discovery and system thinking are limitless. Women's College Hospital is committed to equity, quality and patient safety as key professional values and essential components of daily practice.
With the mobilization of our 2018-2022 Strategic Plan, WCH has entered an exciting phase of its history – strengthening its bond with partners and introducing a new and inspiring vision: Healthcare revolutionized for a healthier and more equitable world.
FOR EXTERNAL APPLICANTS ONLY:
As a condition of employment, you are required to submit proof of full COVID-19 vaccination to the Hospital’s Occupational Health, Safety & Wellness department.
Job Description
Qualifications
Baccalaureate Degree in Nursing
Current registration in good standing with the College of Nurses of Ontario
Current Basic Cardiac Life Support certification required
Experience working with EPIC is an asset
Experience working with COVID positive patients required
Previous experience working in an outpatient clinic setting, ambulatory care or acute care is required
Experience working virtually, with a strong understanding of providing care remotely, especially using remote monitoring programs is strongly recommended
Excellent physical assessment, critical thinking and problem-solving skills required
Able to work collaboratively with interprofessional teams to coordinate patient care and support holistic care of patients
Able to work independently and demonstrate leadership as a patient advocate and educator
Strong communication skills required and with previous team leading experience an asset
Knowledge around community services, partnerships, and resources that have a positive impact on patients in the community is an asset.
Demonstrated record of good performance and acceptable attendance will be considered as part of the selection criteria
Professional behaviour and communication that meets the standards of the professional regulatory college or association, as applicable, and the standards of Women’s College Hospital
This position plays a critical role in acting as an advocate for safety and will demonstrate principles, practices and processes that will optimize a safe environment for all
Closing Statement
Women's College Hospital is a fully affiliated teaching hospital of the University of Toronto and is committed to fairness and equity in employment and our recruitment and selection practices. We encourage applications from Indigenous peoples, people with disabilities, members of sexual minority groups, members of racialized groups, women and any others who may contribute to the further diversification of our Hospital community. Accommodation will be provided in all parts of the hiring process as required under our Access for People with Disabilities policy. Applicants need to make their requirements known in advance.

Title: Registered Nurse / Registered Psychiatric Nurse – Acss - Penticton, BC - Indeed.com
Description:
Job title
:REGISTERED NURSE / REGISTERED PSYCHIATRIC NURSE – ACSS
Community
:PENTICTON
Facility
:PENTICTON HEALTH CENTRE
Status
:PERMANENT FULL TIME
Position Summary
We have an exciting opportunity for an experienced Mental Health & Substance Use Registered Nurse or Registered Psychiatric Nurse to join our Adult Community Support Services (ACSS) team Penticton.
The ACSS team supports people with serious severe and persistent mental health problems and/or problematic substance use who may or may not be in crisis have access to timely, responsive, evidence-based treatment. The team helps people gain skills to live independently and supports to achieve their highest level of functioning and improve quality of life.
As a member of the team you will provide assessment, treatment, case management, community support, and as required, urgent response to clients who may also have serious functional impairment in the domains of physical health and personal, family, financial, occupational, and social life. Functioning as the primary clinician, you will utilize a variety of specialized treatment modalities/therapies for individuals, groups of clients and/or their families.
Shifts of work are Monday to Friday 08:30-16:30.
If you’re an experienced nurse who's passionate about mental health, apply today!
Qualifications
Graduation from an approved school of nursing.
Two years’ of recent related Mental Health & Substance Use experience or an equivalent combination of education, training and experience.
Current practicing registration with the British Columbia College of Nurses and Midwives (BCCNM).
Current valid B.C. driver’s license.

Title: Infirmier(ière) - Postes PERMANENTS et plusieurs spécialités disponibles (2021-2022) - Charlesbourg, QC - Indeed.com
Description:
Il y a de nombreuses raisons pour choisir de faire carrière au CHU de Québec-Université Laval! Ceux qui sont présentement en poste vous diront sans doute qu’il s’agit d’un travail valorisant, qu’ils évoluent dans un milieu de travail unique, qu’ils ont une carrière passionnante et qu’ils ont l’occasion de sauver des vies et des gens sur une base quotidienne. En deux mots, c’est une carrière qui fait du bien!
Notre programme d’accueil, le travail en équipe multidisciplinaire, la formation continue, les activités de reconnaissance, les avantages et les activités pour les employés font du CHU de Québec-Université Laval votre destination carrière de choix!
Un montant forfaitaire de 12 000$ est offert aux candidatures hors réseau de la santé et des services sociaux qui s’engagent à travailler à temps complet pour une année. Un premier versement de 2 000$ est effectué à l’embauche et un second de 10 000$ après 12 mois de rétention à temps complet.
Si vous souhaitez faire une différence dans la vie de nombreuses personnes et évoluer au sein d’une équipe multidisciplinaire, vous pourriez être le candidat idéal. Plusieurs postes sont à combler dans les 5 hôpitaux du CHU de Québec-Université Laval et ce, dans une grande diversité de disciplines!
POSTES PERMANENTS TEMPS COMPLET 10/14
ou
POSTES PERMANENTS TEMPS PARTIEL 8/14, AVEC POSSIBILITÉ DE COMPLÉTER À TEMPS COMPLET
Plusieurs postes sont à combler dans les spécialités et surspécialités ci-dessous:
bloc opératoire
orthopédie
cardiologie
chirurgie
équipe volante
hématologie
hémodialyse
médecine adulte et pédiatrique
neurologie
urologie
néonatalogie
obstétrique
soins intensifs adultes et pédiatriques
traumatologie
urgence
Infirmière technicienne:
assumer la responsabilité d'un ensemble de soins infirmiers en fonction des besoins bio-psycho-sociaux d’usagers ou de groupes de personnes qui lui sont confiés
évaluer l'état de santé de l'usager
déterminer et assurer la réalisation du plan de soins et de traitements infirmiers
prodiguer les soins et traitements, infirmiers et médicaux dans le but de maintenir la santé, de la rétablir et de prévenir la maladie
planifier, dispenser et évaluer l'enseignement aux usagers, à leurs proches et à des groupes de personnes
participer à la recherche visant la promotion de la santé et la prévention de la maladie
OU
Infirmière clinicienne (bachelière):
assumer la responsabilité d'un ensemble de soins infirmiers en fonction des besoins bio-psycho-sociaux d’usagers ou de groupes de personnes qui lui sont confiés
évaluer l'état de santé, déterminer et assurer la réalisation du plan de soins et de traitements infirmiers des usagers présentant des problèmes de santé complexes et/ou des dimensions bio-psycho-sociales variées
prodiguer les soins et traitements, infirmiers et médicaux dans le but de maintenir la santé, de la rétablir et de prévenir la maladie
concevoir, appliquer et évaluer les programmes de soins requérant des connaissances avancées, visant des problèmes de santé complexes et/ou comportant des dimensions bio psycho sociales variées
participer au développement ou adapter des outils cliniques et d'évaluation de la qualité des soins
coordonner le travail d'équipe et exercer un rôle consultatif auprès de ses collègues et de l'équipe interdisciplinaire
identifier, pour les usagers, les besoins et interventions nécessitant une coordination de services dans l’établissement et entre différents établissements ou organismes du milieu. Assurer, le cas échéant, la coordination de ces services
assurer l'orientation du nouveau personnel et participer à la formation des stagiaires
superviser l'enseignement fait aux usagers, à leurs proches et à des groupes de personnes dans les programmes spécifiques
collaborer à la recherche
Exigences :
diplôme d'études collégiales (DEC) en techniques de soins infirmiers
OU
baccalauréat en sciences infirmières ou baccalauréat comportant trois (3) certificats admissibles dont au moins deux (2) certificats reconnus en soins infirmiers
ET
permis d'exercice de l’Ordre des infirmières et infirmiers du Québec (OIIQ)
attestation de réussite du cours de réanimation cardiorespiratoire (RCR) valide
attestation du cours d'arythmies cardiaques est un atout (mentionner au CV et joindre attestation)
Les diplômes exigés pour l'emploi, qui auraient été obtenus hors Québec, doivent être obligatoirement accompagnés d'une évaluation comparative des études effectuées hors Québec (ÉCEEHQ) émise par le Ministère de l'Immigration, de la Francisation et de l'Intégration.
Remarques :
De nombreux avantages s'offrent à vous au CHU de Québec-Université Laval:
formation et jumelage en début d'emploi;
un réseau d'accueil des collègues fut mis sur place afin de faciliter l'intégration socioprofessionnelle des nouveaux employés. Ainsi, vous bénéficierez d'un accueil personnalisé par un membre de l'équipe lors de votre arrivée sur les unités de soins.
préceptorat disponible;
congé pour études universitaires en sciences infirmières possible suite à la réussite de votre probation de 45 quarts de travail;
formation continue offerte tout au long de votre carrière;
ancienneté qui se cumule dans les 5 hôpitaux du CHU de Québec-Université Laval;
diversité des clientèles et des départements donc des défis pour une longue et passionnante carrière;
programme d'aide au employés (PAE);
avantages sociaux complets;
plateforme LifeSpeak: programme de santé mieux-être pour vous et votre famille;
remboursement partiel des frais de scolarité;
programme privilèges: rabais (commerces, restaurants, spa, hôtels, centres de conditionnement physique);
dépanneur de la fondation du CHU de Québec-Université Laval pour se procurer des billets de ski alpin à rabais et des billets de cinéma à rabais, etc.;
programme privilèges: activités de mise en forme (yoga, pilates, zumba, cardio musculation), Défi entreprise; Pentathlon des neige, Parcours de marches près de nos hôpitaux;
distribution de paniers de légumes biologiques l'été;
aires de stationnement sécurisés pour les vélos pour les employés qui voyagent à vélo;
5 hôpitaux du CHU de Québec-UL desservis par les système d'autobus de la RTC et ST Lévis;
aide au cheminement de carrière et outil Webfolio à votre disposition afin de bâtir votre projet professionnel en ligne. Outil conçu pour vous accompagner tout au long de votre carrière professionnelle au CHU de Québec-Université Laval.
Regroupant le CHUL, L'Hôtel-Dieu de Québec, l'Hôpital de l'Enfant-Jésus, l'Hôpital du Saint-Sacrement et l'Hôpital Saint-François d'Assise, le CHU de Québec-Université Laval est le plus important centre hospitalier universitaire du Québec et l'un des plus grands au Canada. Dispensant des soins généraux et spécialisés, mais surtout surspécialisés, le CHU de Québec-Université Laval dessert la population de tout l'est du Québec, soit un bassin de près de deux millions de personnes. Étroitement lié à l'Université Laval et orienté vers l'avenir, il détient également une mission d'enseignement, de recherche dans de nombreux domaines d'excellence et d'évaluation des technologies et des modes d'intervention en santé. Le CHU de Québec-Université Laval compte plus de 12 500 employés, 1 500 médecins, dentistes et pharmaciens, 343 chercheurs réguliers et associés, 169 chercheurs affiliés, de même que 850 étudiants aux cycles supérieurs et 425 bénévoles. www.chudequebec.ca
Si vous postulez d'un appareil mobile (téléphone intelligent, tablette) vous recevrez un courriel d'accusé réception, toutefois, il ne vous sera pas possible d'y joindre votre CV. Afin que votre candidature soit prise en considération, il sera nécessaire d'inclure votre CV à jour. Pour ce faire, vous devez utiliser un ordinateur fixe ou un portable.
Toute demande d'emploi doit être accompagnée des documents attestant que les exigences de l'emploi sont respectées: copie de diplômes et /ou relevés de notes, curriculum vitae, copie d'attestation, s'il y a lieu.
Nous remercions toutes les personnes qui poseront leur candidature, mais nous communiquerons uniquement avec celles retenues pour une entrevue.
Le CHU de Québec-Université Laval applique un programme d'accès à l'égalité et invite les femmes, les membres des minorités visibles et ethniques, les autochtones et les personnes handicapées à présenter leur candidature. Des mesures d'adaptation pourront être offertes, sur demande, selon la situation.

Title: Registered Nurse - Cornwall, ON - Indeed.com
Description:
As part of the Cornwall Community Hospital you uphold the mission, vision and ICARE values in order to create a safe environment for patients/clients, families, staff, physicians and volunteers, recognizing 'Patient Safety' and our hospital's 'Senior Friendly Strategies' as a top priority in creating a culture of safety and 'The Workplace of Choice'. Cornwall Hospital is committed to providing an accessible work environment. Accommodation are available upon request for candidates taking part in the recruitment/selection process.
Summary of responsibilities
As a member of the interdisciplinary team, the role of Registered Nurse (RN) at CCH is to deliver safe, effective, patient-centered, ethical, and evidenced-based nursing care. The overall function of the RN is to assist our patients and community to manage clinical conditions and transitions and maximise their self-care abilities as well as embody a culture of caregiver inclusion in the patient’s plan of care. The RN also acts as a resource for members of the care team.
Requirements of the job
Holds current Certificate of Competence from the College of Nurses of Ontario
Certificate of registration from the College of Nurses of Ontario
Valid Basic Life Support (BLS) certification
Is committed to living the Mission and Values of Cornwall Community Hospital
Demonstrated regular, punctual attendance
Demonstrated commitment to patient safety
With a minimum of 3-4 years med/surg work experience
Demonstrated recent experience relevant to the area of practice
Knowledge and experience in Hickman/Broviac catheters, Port-A-Cath catheters and continuous subcutaneous infusion
Functional level in both official languages (oral and written in English; oral in French – and testing completed)
Asset
Clinical competencies as related to the patient population served on the unit/program of employment
Membership in RNAO
Palliative care courses or certification
Key skills or competencies
Superior interpersonal organizational and communication skills
Ability to work within an interdisciplinary team.
Leadership and decision-making skills
Ability to work under pressure and to adapt to change
Excellent patient assessment, critical thinking, communication (oral and written), and problem solving skills
Ability to develop, implement, evaluate and adapt a therapeutic nursing plan (Care plan)
Ability to teach and mentor RPNs, RNs, students as required
Completes established curricula as required at the unit level
Are you interested in this job
Job Type: Part-time
Salary: $33.90-$48.53 per hour

Title: INFIRMIER(IÈRE) DIPLÔMÉ(E) HORS CANADA(ARM ET DHC)(2021-2022) CAT1-21-2431 - Capitale-Nationale, QC - Indeed.com
Description:
Vous avez toujours souhaité œuvrer au sein d'équipes spécialisées et auprès de clientèles variées? Vous aimeriez multiplier les occasions de perfectionnement et d’avancement dans votre carrière?
N'hésitez plus! Faites comme plusieurs milliers de personnes qui se joignent annuellement au CHU de Québec-Université Laval (CHU).
Notre programme d’accueil, le travail en équipe multidisciplinaire, la formation continue, les activités de reconnaissance, les avantages et les activités pour les employés font du CHU de Québec-Université Laval votre destination carrière de choix!

Plusieurs postes sont à combler dans les 5 hôpitaux du CHU de Québec-Université Laval et ce, dans une grande diversité de disciplines!
En résumé, vous aurez à:
Assumer la responsabilité d'un ensemble de soins infirmiers en fonction des besoins bio-psycho-sociaux d’usagers ou de groupes de personnes qui lui sont confiés.
Évaluer l'état de santé, déterminer et assurer la réalisation du plan de soins et de traitements infirmiers des usagers présentant des problèmes de santé complexes et/ou des dimensions bio-psycho-sociales variées.
Prodiguer les soins et traitements infirmiers et médicaux dans le but de maintenir la santé, de la rétablir et de prévenir la maladie.
Concevoir, appliquer et évaluer les programmes de soins requérant des connaissances avancées, visant des problèmes de santé complexes et/ou comportant des dimensions bio psycho sociales variées.

Coordonner le travail d'équipe et exercer un rôle consultatif auprès de ses collègues et de l'équipe interdisciplinaire.
Identifier, pour les usagers, les besoins et interventions nécessitant une coordination de services dans l’établissement et entre différents établissements ou organismes du milieu. Assurer, le cas échéant, la coordination de ces services.
Assurer l'orientation du nouveau personnel et participer à la formation des stagiaires.
Superviser l'enseignement fait aux usagers, à leurs proches et à des groupes de personnes dans les programmes spécifiques.
Vous devrez offrir une disponibilité de 2 quarts de travail sur 3 selon les quarts suivants : Jour, Soir et Nuit. L’offre d’emploi consiste à un poste permanent d'un minimum 8 jours par quinzaine (30 heures par semaine) incluant une fin de semaine sur deux.
Remarques :
De nombreux avantages s'offrent à vous au CHU de Québec-Université Laval: • Programme pré-intégration pour votre stage clinique sera offert et jumelage en début d’emploi; • Réseau d'accueil des collègues fut mis sur place afin de faciliter l'intégration socioprofessionnelle des nouveaux employés. Regroupant le CHUL, L'Hôtel-Dieu de Québec, l'Hôpital de l'Enfant-Jésus, l'Hôpital du Saint-Sacrement et l'Hôpital Saint-François d'Assise, le CHU de Québec-Université Laval est le plus important centre hospitalier universitaire du Québec et l'un des plus grands au Canada. Dispensant des soins généraux et spécialisés, mais surtout surspécialisés, le CHU de Québec-Université Laval dessert la population de tout l'est du Québec, soit un bassin de près de deux millions de personnes. Si vous postulez d'un appareil mobile (téléphone intelligent, tablette) vous recevrez un courriel d'accusé réception, toutefois, il ne vous sera pas possible d'y joindre votre CV. Afin que votre candidature soit prise en considération, il sera nécessaire d'inclure votre CV à jour. Pour ce faire, vous devez utiliser un ordinateur fixe ou un portable.
Toute demande d'emploi doit être accompagnée des documents attestant que les exigences de l'emploi sont respectées: copie de diplômes et /ou relevés de notes, curriculum vitae, copie d'attestation, s'il y a lieu.
Nous remercions toutes les personnes qui poseront leur candidature, mais nous communiquerons uniquement avec celles retenues pour une entrevue.
Le CHU de Québec-Université Laval applique un programme d'accès à l'égalité et invite les femmes, les membres des minorités visibles et ethniques, les autochtones et les personnes handicapées à présenter leur candidature. Des mesures d'adaptation pourront être offertes, sur demande, selon la situation.
Exigences :
Vous avez toujours souhaité œuvrer au sein d'équipes spécialisées et auprès de clientèles variées? Vous aimeriez multiplier les occasions de perfectionnement et d’avancement dans votre carrière?
N'hésitez plus! Faites comme plusieurs milliers de personnes qui se joignent annuellement au CHU de Québec-Université Laval (CHU).
Notre programme d’accueil, le travail en équipe multidisciplinaire, la formation continue, les activités de reconnaissance, les avantages et les activités pour les employés font du CHU de Québec-Université Laval votre destination carrière de choix!
Un montant forfaitaire de 12 000$ est offert aux candidatures hors réseau de la santé et des services sociaux qui s’engagent à travailler à temps complet pour une année. Un premier versement de 2 000$ est effectué à l’embauche et un second de 10 000$ après 12 mois de rétention à temps complet.
Plusieurs postes sont à combler dans les 5 hôpitaux du CHU de Québec-Université Laval et ce, dans une grande diversité de disciplines!
En résumé, vous aurez à:
Assumer la responsabilité d'un ensemble de soins infirmiers en fonction des besoins bio-psycho-sociaux d’usagers ou de groupes de personnes qui lui sont confiés.
Évaluer l'état de santé, déterminer et assurer la réalisation du plan de soins et de traitements infirmiers des usagers présentant des problèmes de santé complexes et/ou des dimensions bio-psycho-sociales variées.
Prodiguer les soins et traitements infirmiers et médicaux dans le but de maintenir la santé, de la rétablir et de prévenir la maladie.
Concevoir, appliquer et évaluer les programmes de soins requérant des connaissances avancées, visant des problèmes de santé complexes et/ou comportant des dimensions bio psycho sociales variées.
Participer au développement ou adapter des outils cliniques et d'évaluation de la qualité des soins.
Coordonner le travail d'équipe et exercer un rôle consultatif auprès de ses collègues et de l'équipe interdisciplinaire.
Identifier, pour les usagers, les besoins et interventions nécessitant une coordination de services dans l’établissement et entre différents établissements ou organismes du milieu. Assurer, le cas échéant, la coordination de ces services.
Assurer l'orientation du nouveau personnel et participer à la formation des stagiaires.
Superviser l'enseignement fait aux usagers, à leurs proches et à des groupes de personnes dans les programmes spécifiques.
Vous devrez offrir une disponibilité de 2 quarts de travail sur 3 selon les quarts suivants : Jour, Soir et Nuit. L’offre d’emploi consiste à un poste permanent d'un minimum 8 jours par quinzaine (30 heures par semaine) incluant une fin de semaine sur deux.

Title: Infusion Clinic Nurse - Casual - London & St Thomas - London, ON - Indeed.com
Description:
NKS Health is a specialty pharmacy and infusion centre committed to providing exceptional service. NKS Health provides outpatient services including IV infusions, access to specialty lab testing, immunization and TB screening.
NKS Health is recruiting a registered nurse to join our multi-disciplinary team on a part-time/casual basis. The nurse will administer infusion therapy at NKS Health - London and St Thomas clinics
Responsibilities
Provide exceptional patient and customer service in keeping with NKS Health values.
Administer intravenous therapy and assist in monitoring patients under the care of a physician.
Administer intramuscular vaccination and TB skin testing as ordered
Take appropriate action in situations where the safety and well-being of the patient may be compromised.
Adhere to best work safety practices and procedures
Adhere to nursing practices as outlined by the College of Nurses of Ontario (CNO).
Commitment to continuing education
Experience
Minimum of 1-year experience with IVs, hospital nursing preferred.
Experience with IV antibiotics, and biologics preferred
Qualifications
Currently registered and in good standing with the College of Nurses of Ontario (CNO).
Current CPR certification
Proficiency in English, both verbal and written required.
Valid Ontario driver's license and reliable vehicle required.
Excellent Patient assessment and teaching skills.
Possesses the physical ability to perform the day-to-day duties described in the duties and responsibilities.
ACLS and BCLS training required
Part-time hours: 4 per week
Job Types: Part-time, Casual
Salary: From $37.00 per hour
Benefits:
Flexible schedule
On-site parking
Paid time off
Schedule:
Monday to Friday
Experience:
IV start: 1 year (required)
Licence/Certification:
Registered Nurse (RN) (required)
proof of COVID-19 vaccination (required)
Work remotely:
No

Title: REGISTERED NURSE, RPTB - St. Catharines, ON - Indeed.com
Description:
Working to promote nursing excellence, quality patient/client-centered care and high professional standards, the Registered Nurse will be responsible for the assessment, nursing diagnosis, integrated care plan development, implementation and evaluation of nursing care. The objective of the Registered Nurse is to provide safe and competent care through the application of nursing knowledge, the technical aspects of professional practice and the demonstration of compassion, professionalism and respect.
QUALIFICATIONS:
o Current registration with the College of Nurses of Ontario
o Two years related clinical experience in the past five years in a perioperative environment
o Current BCLS certification
o Performs to the full scope of practice as outlined by the College of Nurses of Ontario
o Demonstrated knowledge and skill in physical assessment
o Demonstrated proficiency in IV Therapy and Advanced IV Therapy
o Demonstrated knowledge of and skill with CVADs, Advanced CVADs, PCAs and epidural lines, VAC therapy, enteral feeds, TPN and chest tubes
o Demonstrated ability to develop an integrated plan of care
o Demonstrated knowledge and understanding of nursing standards as they apply to the care of perioperative patients/clients
o Demonstrated commitment to patient/client centred care
o Applies Niagara Health values and leadership skills by providing, facilitating and promoting quality patient care
o Demonstrated ability to perform effectively as most responsible nurse in a total patient care model
o Demonstrated commitment to patient and family education and the ability to promote health and wellness
o Evidence of accurate, timely and appropriate documentation according to best practice guidelines and CNO standards
o Demonstrated ability to facilitate patient discharges
o Applies knowledge, skills, judgment and competencies required for safe practice as outlined by the College of Nurses of Ontario
o Consistent and regular attendance required
o Proficiency in both official languages (English and French) will be considered an asset
o Vaccines (COVID-19 and others) are a new hire requirement of the job unless you have an exemption based on medical or on a ground pursuant to the Ontario Human Rights Code.
Recruitment Specialist: Emily Fabiano; (Please apply through eRecruit; Inquiries only: Emily.Fabiano@niagarahealth.on.ca)
It is Niagara Health policy to give consideration to qualified internal applicants.
We are especially interested in connecting if you...
Value diversity, equity and inclusion;
Are excited about being part of a respectful and hard-working team in the beautiful Region of Niagara;
Identify as a member of one or more of the following groups: equity-seeking group, Indigenous persons, persons with disabilities, persons of diverse sexual orientations and gender identities and all others who may contribute to the further diversification of ideas.
Have background or expertise in the healthcare environment, supporting patient care and providing extraordinary customer-service
In accordance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act, 2005 and the Ontario Human Rights Code, Niagara Health will provide accommodations through the recruitment process to applicants with disabilities. If selected to participate in the recruitment and selection process, please inform Human Resources of the nature of any accommodation(s) that you may require in respect of any materials or processes used to ensure your equal participation.

Title: Registered Nurse(Casual) - Bathurst, NB - Indeed.com
Description:
A casual position is available for a Registered Nurse for our 13 bed residential facility. He/she assumes leadership and works in collaboration with the other care providers and staff members to ensure quality of care and service is provided in accordance with the philosophy, objectives and policies of the Home. Our programs are flexible and client centered.
Successful candidates will have an active registration, leadership abilities and strong communication skills. The staff must have the ability to promote a positive, safe work environment and establish effective working relationships.
Purpose of Job:
The RN participates in the planning and delivery of total nursing care to meet individual residents’ needs in accordance with the philosophy, objectives and policies of the Home. They are responsible for coordinating staff needs of the nursing department, assumes leadership and works in collaboration with other care providers using the nursing process.
Qualifications:
Baccalaureate Nursing Degree from an accredited program OR related work experience
Active registration with the Nurses Association of New Brunswick
Good previous work record
Mentally and physically able to perform assigned duties
Good communication and interpersonal skills
Knowledge of Gerontology
Nursing experience with demonstrated skills in leadership, education and quality improvement
Ability to work in a team setting
Duties and Responsibilities:
Performs the functions that are the responsibility of the Registered Nurse
Contributes to the development and implementation of Nursing Policies and Procedures, Fire Plan and Infection Control
Carries out Policies and Procedures as required
Will be notified of any serious resident problem and will assess the situation before the Physician is notified
Will arrange transfer of a resident to the Hospital in an emergency situation
Reviews in collaboration with the LPN and adjusts the staffing patterns to ensure adequate staffing of all the nursing areas
Replace absent staff when necessary
Assist in the evaluation of LPNs and RAs through observation of work performance and written evaluations
Carries out initial disciplinary action when necessary and refers staff to the Director of Care Services if further action is necessary
Is familiar with the Nursing Department Policy and Procedure Manuals
Is directly responsible to the Management Person "On Call" in any emergency
Ensures regular security checks are made to inspect the physical facility for the safety of residents, staff, volunteers and visitors
Assists in the orientation and supervision of new staff
Supports the need for continuing education through participation and by providing assistance for follow up of in-services as requested
Promotes good relations with staff, residents, sponsors and the general public
Carries out any related activity as assigned by the Director of Care Services
Ensures a comfortable, safe and clean environment
Ensures “Back in Form” warm up exercises and stretches are done prior to each shift
Is knowledgeable of the Home’s Philosophy and Mission and conducts work in a manner consistent with this philosophy
Maintains unit supplies, monitors expiry dates, identifies equipment needs
Utilizes the nursing process within established scope of practice to develop and coordinate the provision of holistic care to residents
Demonstrate, teach and supervise the safe use and care of supplies and assigned equipment required in the provision of resident care
Provides leadership, guidance and assistance to the Nursing Staff
COVID-19 considerations:
Staff are required to self-screen, wear a mask, maintain hand hygiene and have been fully vaccinated by Nov 19, 2021.
ONLY CANDIDATES CURRENTLY IN CANADA AND LEGALLY ALLOWED TO WORK IN CANADA WILL BE CONSIDERED.
We thank all applicants for their interest, but only those selected for an interview will be contacted.
Reference ID: 2021-RN-CAS
Job Types: Part-time, Casual
Salary: From $36.93 per hour
Benefits:
On-site parking
Schedule:
8 hour shift
COVID-19 considerations:
As a condition of obtaining and maintaining employment, candidates will need to provide proof of full vaccination against covid-19, or a valid medical certificate exempting them from the vaccine.
Education:
Bachelor's Degree (preferred)
Licence/Certification:
Nursing (preferred)
Work remotely:
No

Title: Registered Nurse -SPH - Saanichton, BC - Indeed.com
Description:
Job Description:
In accordance with the Vision, Purpose, and Values, and strategic direction of the Vancouver Island Health Authority, patient safety is a priority and a responsibility shared by everyone at VIHA; as such, the requirement to continuously improve quality and safety is inherent in all aspects of this position.
Reports to the Nurse Manager, Department Head, or designate. Plans and provides direct nursing care to patients/residents in the hospital or in the community in accordance with the unit/program philosophy, competency guidelines, policies, and the CRNBC Standards for Nursing Practice in British Columbia.
QUALIFICATIONS:
Education, Training And Experience
Current, practicing membership with BC College of Nurses and Midwives. Two years' recent related experience in a clinical setting where relevant nursing skills and theoretical knowledge has been applied.
Skills And Abilities
Ability to communicate effectively, both verbally and in writing.
Ability to organize assigned workload and set priorities.
Ability to deal effectively with a variety of internal and external contacts, including co-workers, physicians, community agency representatives, patients, residents, and families.
Physical ability to perform the duties of the position.
Job Requirements:
https://jd.viha.ca/JD1009.pdf

Title: Chef d’unité de soins infirmiers en hébergement - Chaudière-Appalaches, QC - Indeed.com
Description:
Un mandat dédié à un milieu de vie animé et dynamique!
Vous collaborerez avec votre direction à la gestion des ressources humaines et à l’application des diverses approches visant l’attraction et la fidélisation du personnel au sein de l’installation;
Relevant du directeur des soins et coordonnateur des services à la clientèle et en étroite collaboration avec les professionnels des différents services, vous participerez à la mise en œuvre des différents programmes cliniques de l’établissement;
Vous collaborerez à la mise en œuvre des objectifs visant l’amélioration continue de la qualité des soins et des services offerts;
Vous participerez au développement des processus d’appréciation, de formation continue et de reconnaissance du personnel des secteurs de soins infirmiers;
Vous participerez à la diffusion des informations et des données issues des différents rapports cliniques et administratifs visant le développement de la culture de sécurité au sein des équipes;
À titre de personne de référence clinico-administrative auprès des secteurs de soins infirmiers, vous conseillerez, supporterez et orienterez les infirmiers(ères) chefs d'équipe afin d'assurer aux résidents des soins et services individualisés, en continu et de qualité;
Vous assurerez la gestion courante des activités des secteurs de soins et des services à la clientèle;
Vous assumerez la gestion des ressources matérielles et informationnelles sous votre responsabilité.
Un profil qui fait la différence! :
Vous détenez une formation en soins infirmiers et êtes membre en règle de l’O.I.I.Q. ?
Vous avez acquis une expérience clinique pertinente de cinq (5) ans et un (1) an dans des fonctions d’encadrement (un atout), préférablement en soins de longue durée du réseau de la santé et des services sociaux ?
Vous exercez un style de gestion qui démontre l’importance que vous accordez au travail d’équipe interdisciplinaire, au respect, à l’écoute, aux gestes de reconnaissance au quotidien et à la communication?
Vous avez une facilité à établir des relations de collaboration auprès des équipes dans le but d’assurer le développement de la qualité des services de soins et de longue durée?
En vous joignant à notre famille
Vous ferez partie d'une organisation reconnue pour son excellence et la qualité des services. Après tout, par deux fois nous avons été agrées avec mention d'honneur par Agrément Canada! Vigi Santé a également été reconnue par Agrément Canada pour deux activités innovatrices : « La semaine sur les droits des résidents » et le « Programme annuel de séjours-vacances pour personnes hébergées » à titre de pratiques exemplaires dignes de mention.
Vous œuvrerez dans une organisation d'expertise en soins de longue durée vouée à une seule mission, soit d’offrir aux personnes hébergées une approche milieu de vie de qualité et aux employés un milieu de travail dynamique et de technologies de l’information d’avant-garde.
Vous évoluerez dans un environnement de travail où votre vision proactive et créative ainsi que votre expertise fonctionnelle seront appréciées et soutenues par les membres de votre direction ainsi que par l'ensemble des gestionnaires.
Alors travailler à Vigi Santé est fait pour vous!
Chef de file
dans le domaine des soins de longue durée
Agréés avec mention d’honneur
par Agrément Canada
15
établissements dans
10 régions administratives
du Québec
40
ans de services
2000
Collaborateurs

1500

Title: Occupational Health Nurse - Elora, ON - Indeed.com
Description:
About Wellpoint:
Wellpoint is a leading national provider of occupational health services. Over the past decade, Wellpoint has grown and innovated to meet the changing demands of a dynamic workforce. Today, Wellpoint has evolved to fully integrated absence management and workplace health solution provider. Wellpoint has serviced more than 1,500 customers across Canada, which includes all levels of government, medium size to large national and multinational corporations, insurance organizations, and numerous manufacturing sectors and We offer several contracts and permanent based positions with lots of room for growth.
Position Summary:
We are actively seeking Self Driven
Occupational Health Nurses
as well as
RPN’s
or
RN’s
who want to pivot their careers into Occupational Health Nurses then this the right opportunity for you
, It's a Full-Time, Permanent Position for evening shifts from Monday to Friday between 3:00 pm to 11:30 pm (with shift premium offered additionally to the base pay )
Responsibilities:
Provide primary care for occupational and non-occupational injuries and illnesses, including effective nursing assessment skills, preparation of care plan, treatment, referral, and accommodation as indicated.
Evaluate the nursing service provided for appropriateness and effectiveness.
Covid screening and follow-up for RTW Clearance.
Case Management services with regards to staying at work, return to work, and accommodation needs as per Human Rights, WSIB and legislation.
Participate in workers’ health maintenance programs through various activities, such as pre-placement and periodic assessments, immunizations, coordination of the hearing conservation program and examinations for compliance ( with the need for medical surveillance ), mobile equipment examinations, designated substance examinations, etc.
Maintain an accurate, timely, and premium record-keeping system.
Provide medical monitoring and surveillance for workers.
Identify health needs for workers, develop objectives, and implement programs in health promotion, maintenance, and rehabilitation.
Participate in Wellness Programs appropriate to the needs of the employee workforce.
A resource to the appropriate personnel in developing and maintaining a safe work environment.
Education & Experience:
Experience in Occupational Health Nursing is an asset
Registered Nurse or Registered Practical Nurse License – in good standing with the College of Nurses of Ontario (CNO)
Diploma in (DOHN) and/or Certification in Occupational Health Nursing (COHN-C) an asset
Valid Certifications in CPR & First Aid
Skills & Qualifications:
Demonstrated working knowledge and understanding of disability legislation and regulations, including Duty to Accommodate, Employment Equity Act, Workplace Safety and Insurance Act, Human Rights Legislation, Accessibility Ontario Disability Act (AODA), Occupational Health and Safety Act
Demonstrated ability to evaluate the nursing service provided for appropriateness and effectiveness
Proficient in computer programs including Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and Electronic Medical Records (EMR)
Ability to work in a cooperative/ collaborative manner to achieve the desired result
Demonstrated problem-solving abilities with quick decision-making skills
Demonstrated ability to maintain strict confidentiality in all areas of responsibility
Excellent interpersonal, diplomacy, and communication skills
Job Types: Full-time, Permanent
